issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: Operator.forward is doing too much. There's no reason to do the "done" checking per row and update it inline. It's much more efficient to just do that when the event that completes an operator happens.
fields.summary: remove some unnecessary branches from the inner loop

comments.body:

ATTACHMENT ID: 12723468 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

It looks to me like this eliminates checking the done flag in every operator but still there is going to be a check for every row in the MapOperator/ExecReducer. Also, it looks like in the tez code path, the done flag check does not exist in the ReduceRecordProcessor. We could be forwarding rows even after an operator has said done.
